title: SSH Key Management
description: An analyst must onboard a developer's SSH key into a PAM system to provide audited, temporary access to a production server.

tasks.description: Receive a request from a developer for SSH access to a specific server, including their public SSH key.
tasks.expected_outcome: Analyst receives the complete access request.

tasks.description: Use the PAM tool to grant the developer's SSH key access to the server for a limited time (e.g., 4 hours).
tasks.expected_outcome: The PAM tool temporarily adds the developer's public key to the server's authorized_keys file.

tasks.description: After the time expires, the PAM tool automatically removes the developer's key from the server, revoking access.
tasks.expected_outcome: Access is automatically and securely revoked without manual intervention.
